description: It is command line, you need to use the web site https://cjavad.github.io/hashit to see what commands you need to use ... Let's try to make the world better.

If you don't like it even though it even says it's command line in the description... and you can use the semi-standard --help or even just -h to get the help, no need to go crazy digging on the web, when a lot of tools won't even take the -h
Complaining and slandering them with such a rating when it does what it says it does is just mean. Is that what kind of person you really want to be, or did your wife just sleep with someone, or what?
Someone point me to a quick "guide to write a gui (or built into context menus) for a command line util" I'd give 'er a go. Haven't programmed Linux for a decade or 2, but tons of programming on PC, PET, IBM Mainframe (assembly - don't), Apple ][+ (now there's fun assembly) etc, since 78 or so. 
Yes, I'd prefer context menu or gui, but it says right there that it doesn't have one.
summary: Does what it says on the box..
